As with all decisions, a wise decision is made from incomplete [[information]]. But in a wise decision the chooser possesses a sense of the way that situations usually turn out and, in its deeper forms, a desire for the outcome to be broadly beneficial.
 
As with all decisions, a wise decision is made from incomplete [[information]]. But in a wise decision the chooser possesses a sense of the way that situations usually turn out and, in its deeper forms, a desire for the outcome to be broadly beneficial.
    −
Classically, wisdom is considered to come with age. In some religions, wisdom is considered a gift granted by [[God]]. The [[Jewish]] book of [[Proverbs]] in the [[Old Testament]] states `Fear of God is the beginning of Wisdom`.
+
Classically, wisdom is considered to come with age. In some religions, wisdom is considered a gift granted by [[God]]. The [[Jew]]ish book of [[Proverbs]] in the [[Old Testament]] states `Fear of God is the beginning of Wisdom`.
     
A wise person is often called a "sage."
 
A wise person is often called a "sage."
